revised_title: Description and Analysis of the Pediculus Caeti and its Shell
tldr: The author, Robert Sibbald, describes the Pediculus Caeti, a unique marine invertebrate found in the North Atlantic. He provides a detailed analysis of its shell, which has a distinct six-sided shape and no spiral twists. Sibbald also discusses the animal's body structure, including its cirri or arms, and its attachment to whales. This creature is a new type of Polypus found in the region, and Sibbald shares his observations to contribute to the understanding of natural history.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
